result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian Bachi

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:51 am 
INCLUDES 19CF340, 20CF158, 20CF524, 22CF261, & 22CF828. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person with Atty Wright Laufenberg. 
VRCW. 
COURT notes 22CF828 needs future date set as it is new file - parties to see JA to set new date. 

SENTENCING HEARING IN 19CF340, 20CF158, 20CF524, & 22CF261. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 19CF340: Ct. 2>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
In 20CF158: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
In 20CF524: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
                   : Ct. 4>>SWH for 1 yr probation. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation>>sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program; Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; no contact with SC unless authorized by agent; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; CC including DNA surcharges (sample already on file). 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit - parties to submit stipulation re: credit at later date if needed. 
COURT has no objection to probation being transferred to deft's home County. 
Adj: 8:58 am
Sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:25 pm 
INCLUDES 20CF158, 20CF524, 22CF261, & 19CF340. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Wright Laufenberg. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
In 20CF158: Cts. 2 - 4>>D&RI. 
In 20CF524: Cts. 2 & 3>>D&RI. 
In 22CF261: Cts. 1 - 4>>D&RI. 
In 19CF340: Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 20CF158: Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/PTAC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 20CF524: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Neglecting a Child/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 19CF340: Ct. 2 (Possess with Intent-Designer Drugs)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT directs parties to see JA to set sentencing hearing. 
Adj: 3:37 pm
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
